Eventually he forms an unlikely bond with one of them -- a damaged, brainy troublemaker (newcomer Dominic Sessa) -- and with the school’s head cook, who lost a son in Vietnam (Da’Vine Joy Randolph). With outstanding critical acclaim, The Holdovers is now the winner of 2 Golden Globes for Best Actor (Comedy) for Paul Giamatti and Best Supporting Actress for Da’Vine Joy Randolph.

2024-01-22.title: Poor Things
2024-01-22.synopsis: From filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone comes the incredible tale and fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter (Stone), a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter (Dafoe).

He challenged authority, never apologized for who he was, what he believed, or who he desired. And he did not back down. He made history, and in turn, he was forgotten. Directed by DGA award and five-time Tony award winner George C. Wolfe and starring Emmy award winner Colman Domingo, Rustin shines a long overdue spotlight on the extraordinary man who, alongside giants like the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., Adam Clayton Powell Jr., and Ella Baker, dared to imagine a different world, and inspired a movement in a march toward freedom. Produced by Academy award winner Bruce Cohen, Higher Ground's Tonia Davis and George C. Wolfe, the film features an all-star cast including Chris Rock, Glynn Turman, Jeffrey Wright and Audra McDonald.

2024-01-22.title: Mean Girls
2024-01-22.synopsis: From the comedic mind of Tina Fey comes a new twist on the modern classic, MEAN GIRLS. New student Cady Heron (Angourie Rice) is welcomed into the top of the social food chain by the elite group of popular girls called “The Plastics,” ruled by the conniving queen bee Regina George (Reneé Rapp) and her minions Gretchen (Bebe Wood) and Karen (Avantika). However, when Cady makes the major misstep of falling for Regina’s ex-boyfriend Aaron Samuels (Christopher Briney), she finds herself prey in Regina’s crosshairs. As Cady sets to take down the group’s apex predator with the help of her outcast friends Janis (Auli’i Cravalho) and Damian (Jaquel Spivey), she must learn how to stay true to herself while navigating the most cutthroat jungle of all: high school.

2024-01-22.title: Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget
2024-01-22.synopsis: After escaping from Tweedy's farm, Ginger and all the chickens living the dream in their peaceful island sanctuary, far from the dangers of the human world.

2024-01-22.title: Saltburn

2024-01-22.title: The Boy And The Heron (Dubbed)
2024-01-22.synopsis: The English dub for Hayao Miyazaki's latest adventure features an all-star cast that includes Robert Pattinson, Florence Pugh, Christian Bale, Willem Dafoe and Mark Hamill. The film follows a young boy named Mahito, who yearns for his late mother and ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There, death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. 2024-01-22.title: LSFF 2024: Present Artefacts
2024-01-22.synopsis:
History is often seen as an indisputable narrative of the past. This programme reminds us that the narrative has a narrator. Who are the ghosts that haunt us, waiting for us to find them, to tell their story? From mockumentary to historic fiction to nostalgic fantasy, these films take us back – and reframe.
 
A reclusive woman in Brooklyn reveals the truth behind electronic music - it was started by Black musicians in the 1920s South. A young woman becomes obsessed with some old photographs of female Arab crossdressers, a filmmaker reconstructs memories with a monk’s long forgotten photographs in a timeless Mount Athos, a found footage film collage collects perceptions of death and hell in religious filter bubbles, a Byzantine farmer accused of heresy is locked in a pillory and forgotten as war rages in the unseen background, and a travelling court jester’s joke spirals into horror in 16th century England.  

Programme: 
– Africans With Mainframes, dir. Kima Hibbert, USA 2023, 15mins
– Neo Nahda, dir. May Ziadé, UK 2023, 12mins
– Light of Light, dir. Neritan Zinxhiria, Greece 2022, 13mins
– Lake Of Fire, dir. Art Collective NEOZOON, Germany 2022, 11mins
– Unorthodox, dir. Konstantinos Antonopoulos, Greece 2022, 23mins
– The Licensed Fool, dir. Gareth Bowen, UK 2023, 17mins

2024-01-22.title: One Life
2024-01-22.synopsis: Follows British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

2024-01-22.title: Nyad
2024-01-22.synopsis:
A remarkable true story of tenacity, friendship and the triumph of the human spirit, NYAD recounts a riveting chapter in the life of world-class athlete Diana Nyad. Three decades after giving up marathon swimming in exchange for a prominent career as a sports journalist, at the age of 60, Diana (four-time Academy Award nominee Annette Bening) becomes obsessed with completing an epic swim that always eluded her: the 110 mile trek from Cuba to Florida, often referred to as the “Mount Everest” of swims. Determined to become the first person to finish the swim without a shark cage, Diana goes on a thrilling, four-year journey with her best friend and coach Bonnie Stoll (two-time Academy Award winner Jodie Foster) and a dedicated sailing team. 


The inspirational film marks the narrative directorial debut of Academy Award-winning documentary filmmakers Elizabeth Chai Vasarhelyi and Jimmy Chin (Free Solo, The Rescue). NYAD is produced by Andrew Lazar, p.g.a. and Teddy Schwarzman, p.g.a. with a screenplay by Julia Cox, adapted from the memoir "Find a Way" by Diana Nyad.

2024-01-22.title: Wonka
2024-01-22.synopsis: The Story will focus on a young Willy Wonka and his adventures prior to opening the world’s most famous chocolate factory.

2024-01-22.title: Boys in the Boat
2024-01-22.synopsis: A 1930s-set story centered on the University of Washington's rowing team, from their Depression-era beginnings to winning gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

2024-01-22.title: Anyone But You
2024-01-22.synopsis: In the comedy Anyone But You, Bea (Sydney Sweeney) and Ben (Glen Powell) look like the perfect couple, but after an amazing first date something happens that turns their fiery hot attraction ice cold - until they find themselves unexpectedly thrust together at a destination wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-01-22.title: Napoleon
2024-01-22.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-01-22.title: Priscilla
2024-01-22.synopsis: When teenage Priscilla Beaulieu meets Elvis Presley at a party, the man who is already a meteoric rock-and-roll superstar becomes someone entirely unexpected in private moments: a thrilling crush, an ally in loneliness, a vulnerable best friend. Through Priscilla’s eyes, Sofia Coppola tells the unseen side of a great American myth in Elvis and Priscilla's long courtship and turbulent marriage, from a German army base to his dream-world estate at Graceland, in this deeply felt and ravishingly detailed portrait of love, fantasy, and fame.

2024-01-22.title: Nimona
2024-01-22.synopsis: When a knight in a futuristic medieval world is framed for a crime he didn’t commit, the only one who can help him prove his innocence is Nimona — a mischievous teen who happens to be a shapeshifting creature he's sworn to destroy.

2024-01-22.title: The End We Start From
2024-01-22.synopsis: When an environmental crisis sees London submerged by flood waters, a young family is torn apart in the chaos. As a woman (Jodie Comer) and her newborn try and find their way home, the profound novelty of motherhood is brought into sharp focus in this intimate and poetic portrayal of family survival.

2024-01-22.title: The Civil Dead
2024-01-22.synopsis: A misanthropic, struggling photographer just wants to watch TV and eat candy while his wife is out of town, but when a desperate old pal resurfaces, his plans are thwarted, with spooky consequences.

2024-01-22.title: Anatomy of a Fall
2024-01-22.synopsis: When her husband Samuel is mysteriously found dead in the snow below their secluded chalet, Sandra becomes the main suspect when the police begin to question whether he fell or was pushed. The trial soon becomes not just an investigation, but a gripping psychological journey into the depths of Sandra and Samuel's complicated marriage. With conflicting evidence and inconsistent testimony, words are wielded like weapons and shocking truths come to light in this thrilling Palme d’Or winner.

2024-01-22.title: Fair Play
2024-01-22.synopsis: When a coveted promotion at a cutthroat financial firm arises, once supportive exchanges between lovers Emily (Phoebe Dynevor) and Luke (Alden Ehrenreich) begin to sour into something more sinister. As the power dynamics irrevocably shift in their relationship, the couple must face the true price of success and the unnerving limits of ambition. In her feature debut, writer-director Chloe Domont weaves a taut relationship thriller, staring down the destructive gender dynamics that pit partners against each other in a world that is transforming faster than the rules can keep up. Also starring Eddie Marsan, Rich Sommer, and Sebastian De Souza, Fair Play unravels the uncomfortable collision of empowerment and ego.

2024-01-22.title: The Killer
2024-01-22.synopsis: A man solitary and cold, methodical and unencumbered by scruples or regrets, the killer waits in the shadows, watching for his next target. And yet the longer he waits, the more he thinks he's losing his mind, if not his cool. A brutal, bloody and stylish noir story of a professional assassin lost in a world without a moral compass, this is a case study of a man alone, armed to the teeth and slowly losing his mind.

2024-01-22.title: Society of the Snow
2024-01-22.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-01-22.title: DocHouse: Rojek
2024-01-22.synopsis:
Filmmaker Zaynê Akyol puts a face to the often disembodied threat of Islamic State (ISIS). In prison camps in Syria, Akyol encounters dozens of detained IS fighters, men and women, who share a common dream: establishing a caliphate.

Confronted with their fundamentalist beliefs, Rojek attempts to trace the beginning, the rise and fall of ISIS through their personal stories. These up-close, unsettling interviews are set against imagery filmed around decimated, post-war Syrian Kurdistan.

This films offers an intimate, uncomfortable gaze at a complex, unknown reality, pointing to an ideological war that extends well beyond the 'fall of ISIS'.

2024-01-22.title: Perfect Days
2024-01-22.synopsis:
A highly anticipated return to fiction feature filmmaking from Wim Wenders (Paris, Texas, Wings of Desire), PERFECT DAYS takes the writer-director to Tokyo to tell a story celebrating the hidden joys and minutiae of Japanese culture. Winner of the Best Actor award at Cannes 2023, Koji Yakusho (Babel, 13 Assassins) stars as Hirayama, a contemplative middle-aged man who lives a life of modesty and serenity, spending his days balancing his job as a dutiful caretaker of Tokyo’s numerous public toilets with his passion for music, literature and photography. As we join him on his structured daily routine, a series of unexpected encounters gradually begin to reveal a hidden past that lies behind his otherwise content and harmonious life. 

Combining a refreshingly unstereotypical depiction of the Japanese capital with a soundtrack comprised of iconic hits from the 60s and 80s, this is a subtle, shimmering and ultimately life-affirming reflection on finding beauty in the everyday world around us. Japan’s entry for Best International Film at the 2024 Academy Awards.

2024-01-22.title: DocHouse: Werner Herzog: Radical Dreamer
2024-01-22.synopsis:
Filmmaker, auteur, poet, actor, doomsayer, truth seeker - Werner Herzog has become a legend in his own right, and at 81 still continues to add to his considerable oeuvre.


Radical Dreamer profiles the man who had a 320-ton steamboat hauled over a hill in Peru, who hypnotises his actors, climbs down into volcanoes, talks to murderers on death row, cooks and eats his own shoe and who once - in an almost magical act - walked from Munich to Paris to prevent the death of a film critic he greatly admired. It is stories like these that have made this most remarkable director a cult figure the world over.

This comprehensive portrait by director Thomas von Steinaecke explores Herzog's work, process and everyday life, bringing together rare archive materials and in-depth interviews with the man himself, as well as celebrated collaborators - including Joshua Oppenheimer, Patti Smith, Christian Bale, Nicole Kidman and his wife, Lena Herzog.

2024-01-22.title: DocHouse: The Disappearance Of Shere Hite
2024-01-22.synopsis:
Feminist researcher Shere Hite changed the discussion around women's sexuality with her groundbreaking studies in the 1970s and 80s, and her books (including The Hite Report) became best-sellers. But both her methodology and her message came under criticism in the backlash from this popularity, and slowly but surely Shere was ridiculed and squeezed out of the mainstream - and eventually out of popular consciousness.

Director Nicole Newnham (Crip Camp) recovers Shere Hite from the margins of history, feminism and academia, exploring the charismatic former model's rise and fall from prominence. Using a treasure trove of archive footage, The Disappearance of Shere Hite transports viewers back to a time of great societal change and transformation around sexuality. It rediscovers a pioneer who has had an unmistakable influence on current conversations around gender and sexuality, and asks what led to Shere's erasure.

A semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation, in tribute to friendship from the mind of Hayao Miyazaki.

2024-01-23.title: Anselm (2D)
2024-01-23.synopsis:
An experience like no other. Wim Wenders creates a portrait of Anselm Kiefer, one of the most innovative and important painters and sculptors of our time, shot in 3D and 6K-resolution. 

The film presents a total immersion in the artist’s work and practice which explores human existence and the cyclical nature of history, inspired by literature, poetry, philosophy, science, mythology and religion. For over two years, Wenders traced Kiefer’s path from his native Germany to his current home in France, connecting the stages of his life to the essential places of his career that spans more than five decades.

2024-01-23.title: LSFF 2024: Very Online + Q&A
2024-01-23.synopsis:
Our everyday lives are inextricably linked with the online one we carry around in our pocket. The distinction between the two becomes ever blurrier, the reassuring algorithmic order of our feeds at odds with chaotic and random reality. With a click or a tap we enter the wormhole, the doomscroll - but what we find there might follow us here. It’s too late to #touchgrass, because the grass has turned to pixels. 

This programme traverses the www across multiple platforms, from OnlyFans to GTA to the murky marketplace of identity theft. Includes new work from guerilla artist collective Total Refusal (Hardly Working), documenting artists’ intervention in, and appropriation of, video game engines and worlds.

Programme:
– My Blonde GF, dir. Rosie Morris, UK 2023, 19mins
– Kinderfilm dir. Adrian Jonas Haim, Michael Stumog, Michael Stumpf, Austria 2023, 12mins
– Murderabilia, dir. Nora Mandray, Germany/France 2023, 15mins
– Alpha Kings, dir. Enrique Pedráza Botero, Faye Tsakas, USA 2022, 15mins
– A Kind Of Testament, dir. Stephen Vuillemin, France 2023, 16mins

Followed by a Q&A on the themes of the programme with the filmmakers.

2024-01-23.title: DocHouse: Scala!!!
2024-01-23.synopsis:
In Britain’s post-punk Thatcher years, the infamous and legendary Scala cinema showed a diverse range of films, from high art to cult classics, sexploitation, horror, Kung-Fu and LGBTQIA+. Nudging boundaries of convention, it became an inspiration for future famous creatives.

With interviews from nearly 50 contributors, previously unseen archive footage and film clips, Scala!!! is an anarchic, uproarious documentary telling the riotous inside story, with an original soundtrack by celebrated musician Barry Adamson.

Transcending nostalgia, Scala!!! is a universal testament to the power of cinemas, providing refuge and community for outsiders. A place where everyone is welcome.

Eventually he forms an unlikely bond with one of them -- a damaged, brainy troublemaker (newcomer Dominic Sessa) -- and with the school’s head cook, who lost a son in Vietnam (Da’Vine Joy Randolph). With outstanding critical acclaim, The Holdovers is now the winner of 2 Golden Globes for Best Actor (Comedy) for Paul Giamatti and Best Supporting Actress for Da’Vine Joy Randolph.

He challenged authority, never apologized for who he was, what he believed, or who he desired. And he did not back down. He made history, and in turn, he was forgotten. Directed by DGA award and five-time Tony award winner George C. Wolfe and starring Emmy award winner Colman Domingo, Rustin shines a long overdue spotlight on the extraordinary man who, alongside giants like the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., Adam Clayton Powell Jr., and Ella Baker, dared to imagine a different world, and inspired a movement in a march toward freedom. Produced by Academy award winner Bruce Cohen, Higher Ground's Tonia Davis and George C. Wolfe, the film features an all-star cast including Chris Rock, Glynn Turman, Jeffrey Wright and Audra McDonald.

2024-01-24.title: Mean Girls
2024-01-24.synopsis: From the comedic mind of Tina Fey comes a new twist on the modern classic, MEAN GIRLS. New student Cady Heron (Angourie Rice) is welcomed into the top of the social food chain by the elite group of popular girls called “The Plastics,” ruled by the conniving queen bee Regina George (Reneé Rapp) and her minions Gretchen (Bebe Wood) and Karen (Avantika). However, when Cady makes the major misstep of falling for Regina’s ex-boyfriend Aaron Samuels (Christopher Briney), she finds herself prey in Regina’s crosshairs. As Cady sets to take down the group’s apex predator with the help of her outcast friends Janis (Auli’i Cravalho) and Damian (Jaquel Spivey), she must learn how to stay true to herself while navigating the most cutthroat jungle of all: high school.

2024-01-24.title: Royal Opera 2023/24 Season: Rusalka
2024-01-24.synopsis:
Rusalka, a water spirit, lives with her family in the pure waters of the forest lake. When she falls in love with a Prince, she sacrifices her voice and leaves her home in the hope of finding true love in a new world – a world that does not love her back.

Natalie Abrahami and Ann Yee create a poetic, contemporary new staging of Dvořák’s lyric fairy tale, revealing our uneasy relationship with the natural world and humanity’s attempts to own and tame it. Semyon Bychkov conducts an all-star cast featuring Asmik Grigorian (Jenůfa) in the title role.

2024-01-24.title: Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget
2024-01-24.synopsis: After escaping from Tweedy's farm, Ginger and all the chickens living the dream in their peaceful island sanctuary, far from the dangers of the human world.

2024-01-24.title: Saltburn
2024-01-24.synopsis: Struggling to find his place at Oxford University, student Oliver Quick finds himself drawn into the world of the charming and aristocratic Felix Catton, who invites him to Saltburn, his eccentric family's sprawling estate, for a summer never to be forgotten.

2024-01-24.title: The Boy And The Heron (Dubbed)
2024-01-24.synopsis: The English dub for Hayao Miyazaki's latest adventure features an all-star cast that includes Robert Pattinson, Florence Pugh, Christian Bale, Willem Dafoe and Mark Hamill. The film follows a young boy named Mahito, who yearns for his late mother and ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There, death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. The Boy and the Heron is a dazzling, semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation.

2024-01-24.title: LSFF 2024: Gothic
2024-01-24.synopsis:
Light a lantern and wander through thick fog and haunted barren moors to experience the uncanny, inexplicable, folkloric and mythical with our returning anthology of Gothic shorts. Brace yourself to encounter cultish vaulting classes, unstoppable termite infestations, sprouting ears, anthropomorphic snakes and demonic carers. 

Extra appendages and uncanny noises from deep within the body evoke abject horror, and the unknown and unseen lurks around every corner. Herds of cows and horses suddenly seem sinister in the dark. Bring some eerie vibes to a cold January night with one of LSFF’s perennial programmes, featuring films from Spain, Ireland, Argentina and the UK. Don't say we didn't warn you.

Programme:
– White Ant, dir. Shalini Adnani, UK 2023, 14mins
– Exceptional Tales from a Young Female Team: Reds, dir. Tom Espinoza, 2022, Argentina, 14mins
– The Third Ear, dir. Nathan Ginter, USA 2023, 13mins
– Perfect City: The Bravest Kid, dir. Shengwei Zhou, USA 2023, 6mins
– Transition, dir. David Velduque, Spain 2023, 16mins
– Calf, dir. Jamie O'Rourke, Ireland 2023, 15mins
– Meantime, dir. Guillaume Scaillet, France 2022, 12mins
– SHÉ (Snake), dir. Renee Zhan, UK 2023, 15mins

2024-01-24.title: Nyad
2024-01-24.synopsis:
A remarkable true story of tenacity, friendship and the triumph of the human spirit, NYAD recounts a riveting chapter in the life of world-class athlete Diana Nyad. Three decades after giving up marathon swimming in exchange for a prominent career as a sports journalist, at the age of 60, Diana (four-time Academy Award nominee Annette Bening) becomes obsessed with completing an epic swim that always eluded her: the 110 mile trek from Cuba to Florida, often referred to as the “Mount Everest” of swims. Determined to become the first person to finish the swim without a shark cage, Diana goes on a thrilling, four-year journey with her best friend and coach Bonnie Stoll (two-time Academy Award winner Jodie Foster) and a dedicated sailing team. 


The inspirational film marks the narrative directorial debut of Academy Award-winning documentary filmmakers Elizabeth Chai Vasarhelyi and Jimmy Chin (Free Solo, The Rescue). NYAD is produced by Andrew Lazar, p.g.a. and Teddy Schwarzman, p.g.a. with a screenplay by Julia Cox, adapted from the memoir "Find a Way" by Diana Nyad.

2024-01-24.title: Wonka
2024-01-24.synopsis: The Story will focus on a young Willy Wonka and his adventures prior to opening the world’s most famous chocolate factory.

2024-01-24.title: Anyone But You
2024-01-24.synopsis: In the comedy Anyone But You, Bea (Sydney Sweeney) and Ben (Glen Powell) look like the perfect couple, but after an amazing first date something happens that turns their fiery hot attraction ice cold - until they find themselves unexpectedly thrust together at a destination wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-01-24.title: One Life
2024-01-24.synopsis: Follows British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

2024-01-24.title: Priscilla
2024-01-24.synopsis: When teenage Priscilla Beaulieu meets Elvis Presley at a party, the man who is already a meteoric rock-and-roll superstar becomes someone entirely unexpected in private moments: a thrilling crush, an ally in loneliness, a vulnerable best friend. Through Priscilla’s eyes, Sofia Coppola tells the unseen side of a great American myth in Elvis and Priscilla's long courtship and turbulent marriage, from a German army base to his dream-world estate at Graceland, in this deeply felt and ravishingly detailed portrait of love, fantasy, and fame.

2024-01-24.title: Boys in the Boat
2024-01-24.synopsis: A 1930s-set story centered on the University of Washington's rowing team, from their Depression-era beginnings to winning gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

2024-01-24.title: Nimona
2024-01-24.synopsis: When a knight in a futuristic medieval world is framed for a crime he didn’t commit, the only one who can help him prove his innocence is Nimona — a mischievous teen who happens to be a shapeshifting creature he's sworn to destroy.

2024-01-24.title: The End We Start From
2024-01-24.synopsis: When an environmental crisis sees London submerged by flood waters, a young family is torn apart in the chaos. As a woman (Jodie Comer) and her newborn try and find their way home, the profound novelty of motherhood is brought into sharp focus in this intimate and poetic portrayal of family survival.

2024-01-24.title: The Civil Dead
2024-01-24.synopsis: A misanthropic, struggling photographer just wants to watch TV and eat candy while his wife is out of town, but when a desperate old pal resurfaces, his plans are thwarted, with spooky consequences.

2024-01-24.title: Fair Play
2024-01-24.synopsis: When a coveted promotion at a cutthroat financial firm arises, once supportive exchanges between lovers Emily (Phoebe Dynevor) and Luke (Alden Ehrenreich) begin to sour into something more sinister. As the power dynamics irrevocably shift in their relationship, the couple must face the true price of success and the unnerving limits of ambition. In her feature debut, writer-director Chloe Domont weaves a taut relationship thriller, staring down the destructive gender dynamics that pit partners against each other in a world that is transforming faster than the rules can keep up. Also starring Eddie Marsan, Rich Sommer, and Sebastian De Souza, Fair Play unravels the uncomfortable collision of empowerment and ego.

2024-01-24.title: The Killer
2024-01-24.synopsis: A man solitary and cold, methodical and unencumbered by scruples or regrets, the killer waits in the shadows, watching for his next target. And yet the longer he waits, the more he thinks he's losing his mind, if not his cool. A brutal, bloody and stylish noir story of a professional assassin lost in a world without a moral compass, this is a case study of a man alone, armed to the teeth and slowly losing his mind.

2024-01-24.title: Society of the Snow
2024-01-24.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-01-24.title: Anatomy of a Fall
2024-01-24.synopsis: When her husband Samuel is mysteriously found dead in the snow below their secluded chalet, Sandra becomes the main suspect when the police begin to question whether he fell or was pushed. The trial soon becomes not just an investigation, but a gripping psychological journey into the depths of Sandra and Samuel's complicated marriage. With conflicting evidence and inconsistent testimony, words are wielded like weapons and shocking truths come to light in this thrilling Palme d’Or winner.

2024-01-24.title: DocHouse: Werner Herzog: Radical Dreamer
2024-01-24.synopsis:
Filmmaker, auteur, poet, actor, doomsayer, truth seeker - Werner Herzog has become a legend in his own right, and at 81 still continues to add to his considerable oeuvre.


Radical Dreamer profiles the man who had a 320-ton steamboat hauled over a hill in Peru, who hypnotises his actors, climbs down into volcanoes, talks to murderers on death row, cooks and eats his own shoe and who once - in an almost magical act - walked from Munich to Paris to prevent the death of a film critic he greatly admired. It is stories like these that have made this most remarkable director a cult figure the world over.

This comprehensive portrait by director Thomas von Steinaecke explores Herzog's work, process and everyday life, bringing together rare archive materials and in-depth interviews with the man himself, as well as celebrated collaborators - including Joshua Oppenheimer, Patti Smith, Christian Bale, Nicole Kidman and his wife, Lena Herzog.

2024-01-24.title: DocHouse: Rojek
2024-01-24.synopsis:
Filmmaker Zaynê Akyol puts a face to the often disembodied threat of Islamic State (ISIS). In prison camps in Syria, Akyol encounters dozens of detained IS fighters, men and women, who share a common dream: establishing a caliphate.

Confronted with their fundamentalist beliefs, Rojek attempts to trace the beginning, the rise and fall of ISIS through their personal stories. These up-close, unsettling interviews are set against imagery filmed around decimated, post-war Syrian Kurdistan.

This films offers an intimate, uncomfortable gaze at a complex, unknown reality, pointing to an ideological war that extends well beyond the 'fall of ISIS'.

2024-01-25.title: National Theatre Live: Dear England
2024-01-25.synopsis:
Joseph Fiennes (The Handmaid’s Tale) plays Gareth Southgate in James Graham’s (Sherwood) gripping examination of nation and game. The country that gave the world football has since delivered a painful pattern of loss. Why can’t England’s men win at their own game?
With the worst track record for penalties in the world, Gareth Southgate knows he needs to open his mind and face up to the years of hurt, to take team and country back to the promised land.
Filmed live on stage at the National Theatre, Rupert Goold (Judy) directs this spectacular new play.

2024-01-25.title: LSFF 2024: London Lives
2024-01-25.synopsis:
London's vastness beckons to those looking for something different, somewhere to think and speculate, someplace to retreat and take refuge. Repetition of the everyday and the never-ending skyline offer assurance and ease. Or compel you to investigate the most pressing question plaguing Londoners: what are those 200-foot metal structures dotting the city?  

This brilliant line up of London centric films captures the widely experienced emotions of anxiety, the unsettling shift into adulthood, and the dreaded "panic years." One filmmaker examines why we accept things the way we do in a wry and amusing documentary, while another brings alive the historic landscape in a series of visually compelling montages. Warda Mohamed’s debut narrative intimately depicts the different ways people can grieve and the unexpected connections you can find in those solemn moments.

Programme:
– Highgate 214, dir. Teva Cheema, UK 2023, 19mins
– Bakari, dir. Rodrigue Wembi Ghenda, UK 2023, 11mins
– Messenger, dir. Alix Eve, UK 2023, 16mins
– Brixton Bustle, dir. Shaun Clark, UK 2023, 5mins
– London's Rocketship Launchers, dir. Julia Mervis, UK 2022, 7mins
– Descent, dir. Syd Farrington, UK 2023, 6mins
– An Ode to The Pigeon, dir. Rosa May Tweedale Gamsu, UK 2023, 3mins
– One Night On Saturn, dir. R Seventeen, UK 2021, 7mins
– Muna, dir. Warda Mohamed, UK 2023, 19mins

2024-01-25.title: DocHouse: The Disappearance Of Shere Hite
2024-01-25.synopsis:
Feminist researcher Shere Hite changed the discussion around women's sexuality with her groundbreaking studies in the 1970s and 80s, and her books (including The Hite Report) became best-sellers. But both her methodology and her message came under criticism in the backlash from this popularity, and slowly but surely Shere was ridiculed and squeezed out of the mainstream - and eventually out of popular consciousness.

Director Nicole Newnham (Crip Camp) recovers Shere Hite from the margins of history, feminism and academia, exploring the charismatic former model's rise and fall from prominence. Using a treasure trove of archive footage, The Disappearance of Shere Hite transports viewers back to a time of great societal change and transformation around sexuality. It rediscovers a pioneer who has had an unmistakable influence on current conversations around gender and sexuality, and asks what led to Shere's erasure.

2024-01-26.title: Maestro
2024-01-26.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-01-26.title: LSFF 2024: British Lives
2024-01-26.synopsis:
We head outside of the M25 and leave London behind on a road trip across Great Britain. This anthology of shorts from filmmakers outside of the capital attempts to reflect the nation and its people in all of their complicated, idiosyncratic, multitudinous glory. Join us as we journey through England, Scotland and Wales to unearth new work that captures something of the experience of living in a certain place, location-specific rituals and quirks, and the interiority of our fellow countrypeople. 

Our stops along the way include a military training exercise for delivering tragic news, the strange connection between Welsh proverbs and motorised transport, and hear the mythic tale of the Smoking Dolphins, told in a working men’s club.

Programme:
– Desire Lines, dir. Duncan Cowles, UK 2022, 8mins
– Starling, dir. Matthew Boyle, UK 2023, 13mins
– Stable, dir. David Leon, UK 2023, 16mins
– Smoking Dolphins, dir. Sean Lyons, UK 2022, 7mins 
– Never Mind Walnut Street, dir. Marta Dyczkowska, UK 2023, 13mins
– Chickenshit, dir. Ellie Rogers, UK 2023, 8mins
– Ticker, dir. Thom Petty, UK 2023, 9mins 
– Welsh Motoring Proverbs, dir. Iolo Edwards, UK 2022, 7mins
– Love is Free, dir. Hannah Renton, UK 2022, 15mins

2024-01-26.title: All Of Us Strangers
2024-01-26.synopsis: One night in his near-empty tower block in contemporary London, Adam (Andrew Scott) has a chance encounter with a mysterious neighbor Harry (Paul Mescal), which punctures the rhythm of his everyday life. As a relationship develops between them, Adam is preoccupied with memories of the past and finds himself drawn back to the suburban town where he grew up, and the childhood home where his parents (Claire Foy and Jamie Bell), appear to be living, just as they were on the day they died, 30 years before.

2024-01-26.title: Samsara
2024-01-26.synopsis:
Samsara is the Buddhist cycle of death and reincarnation. From the temples of Laos, alongside with teenage monks, we will accompany a soul in its transit from one body to another through the bardo. The words of the "Tibetan Book of the Dead" will be our guide to avoid getting lost in the afterlife. A luminous and sonorous journey that will lead us to reincarnate on the beaches of Zanzibar, where groups of women work in seaweed farms.

CONTENT WARNING: This film contains flickering or flashing lights that may affect those with photosensitive epilepsy.

2024-01-26.title: DocHouse: Miucha: The Voice Of Bossa Nova
2024-01-26.synopsis:
Brazilian singer Miúcha was associated with some of Bossa Nova's biggest (male) legends - she was known as the sister of Chico Buarque, the pupil of Vinicius de Moraes and the wife of the 'father' of the genre, João Gilberto. But her own role in the developing movement has been neglected.

A gorgeous film to watch, set to the soundtrack of Miúcha's music and saturated with Bossa Nova vibes, Miúcha: The Voice of Bossa Nova tells her story through 16mm home movies, diaries, personal letters and her own expressive watercolour paintings, animated for the film.

Even as she struggled to find her own voice in the shadow of her revered husband, Miúcha went on to earn unprecedented success, becoming a symbol of female resilience and a musical legend.

2024-01-27.title: American Fiction
2024-01-27.synopsis: AMERICAN FICTION is Cord Jefferson's hilarious directorial debut, which confronts our culture’s obsession with reducing people to outrageous stereotypes. Jeffrey Wright stars as Monk, a frustrated novelist who’s fed up with the establishment profiting from “Black” entertainment that relies on tired and offensive tropes. To prove his point, Monk uses a pen name to write an outlandish “Black” book of his own, a book that propels him to the heart of hypocrisy and the madness he claims to disdain.

2024-01-27.title: LSFF 2024: Viva Cinema!
2024-01-27.synopsis:
“I live in cinema. I feel I've lived here forever.”
– Agnes Varda

Cinema will never die. Trends and markets may shift, but the magic of the projected image is a light that will never go out, thanks to the dedication of those who make, produce and show it, often against the odds. Join your fellow cinephiles on-screen and off with this selection of shorts that goes behind the scenes of the process and the passion; an ode to old-school technique and community, to construction and care, to time and luck.

A group of Tanzanian cinema-lovers keep social film-going alive across a network of rural villages and towns as Cypriot VHS shop struggles to survive. The super8 home movie boom, the extravagant technicolour fantasies of the 1950s, and an unforgettable canine star. Includes new work by Mark Jenkin (Bait, Enys Men), Jarman Award winner Michelle Williams Gamaker, and animator Ainslie Henderson (A Cat Called Dom).

Programme:
– A Dog Called Discord, dir. Mark Jenkin, UK 2023, 23mins
– Dream Factory, dir. Alex Matraxia, UK 2023, 7mins
– Thieves, dir. Michelle Williams Gamaker, UK 2023, 27mins 
– Death of a format, dir. Marios Lizides, Cyprus 2023, 11mins
– Shackle, dir. Ainslie Henderson, UK 2022, 10mins
– Apostles of Cinema, dir. Cece Mlay, Darragh Amelia, Gertrude Malizana, Jesse Gerard Mpango, Tanzania 2022, 16mins

2024-01-27.title: Met Opera 2024: Carmen
2024-01-27.synopsis: Acclaimed English director Carrie Cracknell makes her Met debut, reinvigorating the classic story of deadly passion with a staging that moves the action to the present day, amid a band of human traffickers. Mezzo-soprano Aigul Akhmetshina leads a powerhouse quartet of stars in the touchstone role of the irresistible femme fatale, alongside tenor Piotr Beczała as Carmen’s lover Don José, soprano Angel Blue as the devoted Micaëla, and bass-baritone Kyle Ketelsen as the swaggering Escamillo. Daniele Rustioni conducts Bizet’s heart-pounding score.

2024-01-27.title: Kids Club: A Mystery on the Cattle Hill Express
2024-01-27.synopsis:
The third instalment in the family favourite Cattle Hill franchise is finally here! Farmyard hero, Klara the cow, joined by friends old and new, sets off on her latest epic adventure in which she must solve a runaway mystery to save her home.

With the farms of Cattle Hill struggling to produce enough supplies, genius inventor pig, Albert Einswein, formulates a revolutionary new ‘super seed’ as the perfect solution to this problem. Transported on what should be a super-secure, hyper-modern railway, disaster strikes when the seed suddenly vanishes one night! Believing a master thief is to blame, passengers Klara and Gaute team up with world-famous detective, Agatha Chichester, to solve the crime and save Cattle Hill.

2024-01-27.title: DocHouse: Pure Unknown
2024-01-27.synopsis:
Every night nameless bodies land in Dr. Cristina Cattaneo’s autopsy room. She calls them the Pure Unknown. These Pure Unknown often belong to the fringes of society. They are homeless, sex workers, runaway teenagers. Lately, they have mostly been migrants, rejected by the Mediterranean Sea onto the shores of Italy. 



 If all rights belong to the living, nothing is left to the dead. So what happens when the dead have lost their identity? In the face of this growing multitude, no one seems concerned about their right to dignity. No one but Cristina.

2024-01-27.title: DocHouse: After Work
2024-01-27.synopsis:
Our society is a work society. From childhood we are taught to be result oriented and competitive. As automation and artificial intelligence exceed human capacity, we will be forced to rethink the role work plays in our lives: the majority of jobs that exist today could vanish in a few decades. 



The debate about the consequences of this has been dominated by technology experts and economists and often painted as a sci-fi dystopia. What is absent is the human perspective, in the sense of a look at what this will mean to us as human beings. With characters and narratives across four continents, the film seeks an existential answer to what work means today, what things could be like in the future and what will happen to us when we don’t work.

2024-01-28.title: The Zone of Interest
2024-01-28.synopsis: The commandant of Auschwitz, Rudolf Höss, and his wife Hedwig, strive to build a dream life for their family in a house and garden next to the camp.

2024-01-28.title: LSFF 2024: Award Winners
2024-01-28.synopsis: Join the London Short Film Festival, the filmmakers, our partners and film fans from all over London for our annual awards ceremony. A chance to view the cream of the LSFF crop as we announce the winners of Best UK Short (supported by British Council), Best International Short (supported by NOWNESS China), and Best Lo-Budget Short. All winning films will screen during the ceremony. We invite you to the bar afterwards to enjoy a drink with us and a chat with the nominees and the festival team.

2024-01-28.title: Royal Opera 2023/24 Season: Rusalka
2024-01-28.synopsis:
Rusalka, a water spirit, lives with her family in the pure waters of the forest lake. When she falls in love with a Prince, she sacrifices her voice and leaves her home in the hope of finding true love in a new world – a world that does not love her back.

Natalie Abrahami and Ann Yee create a poetic, contemporary new staging of Dvořák’s lyric fairy tale, revealing our uneasy relationship with the natural world and humanity’s attempts to own and tame it. Semyon Bychkov conducts an all-star cast featuring Asmik Grigorian (Jenůfa) in the title role.

2024-01-28.title: DocHouse: This Blessed Plot
2024-01-28.synopsis:
When a young Chinese filmmaker arrives in Thaxted, a small Essex village, she discovers the dead surround the living and the border between them is easily crossed.


Played by a cast of non-professional actors, the latest film from Marc Isaacs is a playful tale of love, loss and betrayal. Following on from his previous, hybrid feature The Filmmaker's House (2020), This Blessed Plot is Isaacs' attempt to innovate by remaining outside conventional industrial film production structures. He works with people from some of his past docs and new characters he has encountered in Thaxted.

2024-01-28.title: DocHouse: March On Rome
2024-01-28.synopsis: Through little-seen archive and his characteristically cinematic analysis, Mark Cousins narrates the ascent of fascism in Italy and its fall-out across 1930s Europe. Both essay film and historical document, Cousins contextualises history through the now, holding a mirror to a political landscape of a creeping far right and manipulated media.

2024-01-28.title: Poor Things
2024-01-28.synopsis: From filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone comes the incredible tale and fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter (Stone), a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter (Dafoe).

2024-01-29.title: My Friend Lanre
2024-01-29.synopsis:
Acclaimed filmmaker Leo Regan draws on decades of footage to create a fascinating portrait of the compelling life of friend and photographer Lanre Fehintola.

Leo Regan and Lanre Fehintola have been friends, photographers and close collaborators for over 25 years. Around the turn of the millennium Lanre’s complex relationship to heroin was documented in two ground-breaking films Don’t Get High on Your Own Supply (1998) and Cold Turkey (2001).

This intensely intimate film follows Lanre as he faces his ultimate challenge, his own terminal illness. Using his extensive archive, Regan presents a tender, funny and deeply moving portrayal of friendship and collaboration; a bravely personal, living testament to one person’s life and work.
